definition: motive/purpose/(sth) being the motive or purpose

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: As a safeguard, officers-in-charge of departments are requested to verify identification by comparing signatures.
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，部门负责主管应比对签字检验身份。

sentences.english: For simplicity, the synchronization of data with the server is omitted.
sentences.chinese: 为简单起见，此处省略服务器段的数据同步。

sentences.english: To be on the safe Side , we insist on the payment by L / C .
sentences.chinese: 为保险起见，我们坚持采用信用状付款。

sentences.english: Before delivering the job, run the spelling and grammar checker once more, just for safety's sake.
sentences.chinese: 在交活儿以前，仅为保险起见，须再运行一次拼写。

sentences.english: For safety's sake , travel in pairs .
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，要出双入对。

sentences.english: A curved margin of a highway was reflectorized for safety.
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见公路的弯道边上装设了反射镜。

sentences.english: For safetys sake, I reckon youll have to insure it beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 为了安全起见，我认为您应该预先保价为好。

sentences.english: For simplicity, this example installs its code in the default targets.
sentences.chinese: 为了简单起见，这个示例在缺省目标处安装其代码。

sentences.english: For security purposes, your checking account number must be re-entered.
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，确认帐户号码时必须重新输入。

sentences.english: For the sake of simplicity, I just return the error message if the call fails.
sentences.chinese: 为简便起见，调用失败时仅返回错误消息。

sentences.english: For safty's sake, travel in pairs.
sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，要出双入对。

sentences.english: Some instructors could be seen discreetly cleaning their hands with antiseptic wipes.
sentences.chinese: 礼毕，一些教官为了安全起见用杀菌水洗手。

sentences.english: I had taken off the stars, but that was for convenience.
sentences.chinese: 我已把袖管上的星章割掉，那只是为了便利起见。

sentences.english: Knitting mistakes can be corrected by taking stitches out one-at-a-time for the sake of security.
sentences.chinese: 针织错误可以纠正了一个在给时为安全起见，采取针。

sentences.english: To be fair, each worker is asked to do different jobs in rotation.
sentences.chinese: 为了公平起见，每一位工人均被要求轮调工作。

sentences.english: To be safe, I prescribed an equal dose of castor oil for him.
sentences.chinese: 为了安全起见，我也给他吃了同样多的蓖麻子油。

definition: to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
dependable
security consideration
surefire; absolutely safe (idiom)
to fool people (idiom)/to pull the wool over people's eyes
cautious/careful/prudent
cautious/prudent
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
cautious and timid (idiom); prudent/careful
to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
to act with urgency/to buy time
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
so as not to/so as to avoid
Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
to save from damage/to preserve/to maintain/to keep in good repair/(Tw) security guard
appropriate/proper/ready
